configSchema.title: MCP Session Configuration

LOG_LEVEL.description:
Control server logging verbosity for debugging and monitoring.

- "DEBUG": Shows all details including internal operations (verbose, use for troubleshooting)
- "INFO": Normal operation logs (recommended for development)
- "WARNING": Only warnings and errors (recommended for production)
- "ERROR": Only error messages (minimal logging)

**Default:** "INFO"
**Example:** Use "DEBUG" when troubleshooting tool execution issues

RAG_ENABLED.description:
Enable semantic code search with vector embeddings using RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation).

**Requirements:**
- Requires `boring-aicoding[vector]` installation
- Install with: `pip install "boring-aicoding[vector]"`
- After installation, use `boring_rag_reload` tool to hot-reload dependencies

**Features Enabled:**
- Semantic code search (`boring_rag_search`)
- Codebase indexing (`boring_rag_index`)
- Dependency graph expansion

**Default:** true (enabled by default, requires dependencies)
**Example:** Set to false if you don't need semantic search capabilities

BORING_MCP_MODE.description:
Enable or disable MCP (Model Context Protocol) tool registration.

- "1": Enables all 55+ MCP tools for full functionality
- "0": Disables MCP functionality (minimal mode)

**Default:** "1" (recommended for full feature access)
**Example:** Set to "0" only if you need minimal tool exposure

SHADOW_MODE_LEVEL.description:
Human-in-the-loop protection level for write operations.

- "DISABLED": No protection, all operations execute immediately (not recommended)
- "ENABLED": Auto-approve low-risk operations, require approval for high-risk (recommended default)
- "STRICT": Require explicit approval for all write operations (recommended for production)

**Default:** "ENABLED" (balanced safety and usability)
**Example:** Use "STRICT" in production environments for maximum safety

BORING_MCP_PROFILE.description:
Select the toolset profile to load (V11+).

- "ultra_lite": Essential tools only (97% token savings, good for reasoning models)
- "minimal": Read-only context (files + RAG)
- "lite": Daily driver (core tools + git)
- "standard": Balanced suite (recommended default)
- "full": Maximum power (security, vibe check, agents)

**Default:** "standard"
**Example:** Use "ultra_lite" for low token usage

VERIFICATION_LEVEL.description:
Default code verification strictness level used by verification tools.

- "BASIC": Syntax checking only (fastest, minimal checks)
- "STANDARD": Includes linting and style checks (recommended default)
- "FULL": Includes tests and comprehensive checks (thorough, slower)
- "SEMANTIC": AI-powered code review (most comprehensive, requires LLM API)

**Default:** "STANDARD" (balanced quality and speed)
**Example:** Use "FULL" before production deployments, "SEMANTIC" for critical code reviews

PROJECT_ROOT_DEFAULT.description:
Default working directory for file operations when project_path parameter is not specified in tool calls.

- Use "." for current working directory
- Use absolute paths like "/home/user/projects/my-app" for specific projects
- Relative paths are resolved from the server's working directory

**Default:** "." (current directory)
**Example:** "/home/user/my-project" or "."

BORING_ALLOW_DANGEROUS.description:
âš ï¸ **DANGEROUS SETTING**: Skip human approval for destructive operations.

**Security Warning:**
- Only enable in fully isolated environments (containers, sandboxes)
- When enabled, operations like file deletion, system commands may execute without confirmation
- Shadow Mode protection still applies when SHADOW_MODE_LEVEL is set

**Default:** false (recommended for safety)
**Example:** Set to true only in CI/CD pipelines with proper isolation

configSchema.description:
Configure the Boring AI Development Assistant for autonomous code generation and verification.

**Required Configuration:**
- All parameters are optional with sensible defaults
- For production use, set SHADOW_MODE_LEVEL to "STRICT" for maximum safety
- Enable RAG_ENABLED for semantic code search capabilities (requires additional dependencies)

**Documentation:** https://github.com/Boring206/boring-gemini
**Examples:** See README.md for configuration examples
